name: Westin Savannah Harbor Golf Resort & Spa

reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel but lacks service
reviews.text: This was out first trip to Savannah and we chose the Westin based on a friend's recommendation. This hotel makes an amazing first impression. The exterior is grand, the lobby is gorgeous and the grounds are perfectly kept. The riverfront location can't be beat - we loved watching the huge cargo ships going up and down the river all day. This hotel is located across the river from downtown Savannah so you must take a ferry to get to most things. The ferry runs on a prompt schedule so it's really not a hassle.

reviews.title: Great location and views!
reviews.text: I say this hotel lacks service because during my stay I got sick with a 24 hour stomach flu. I spent the first day of my vacation in bed, unable to eat anything. We made several calls to room service thoughout the day to order Gatorade and water. We let them know I was sick and needed these items quickly. They didn't care - one order took an hour and 45 minutes - for a drink. There is just no excuse for that. I understand they have other guests they are trying to take care of, but when a guest teels you they are in bed sick and they need a drink, it shouldn't take that long.

reviews.title: Westin-You can't go wrong!
reviews.text: Thankfully on the second day of our vacation I felt much better and we were able to sightsee. We decided that the next time we are in Savannah, we will be staying somewhere on the otherside. It would have been so much more convenient to walk out your front door and be in the heart of the action. Like I said, they ferry wasn't a big hassle, but not as easy as being right there.

reviews.title: Wonderful Staff....Great Southern Hospitality!
reviews.text: Overall, this is a very nice hotel and I wouldn't discourage people from staying here because of my one bad experience. Just know that things may be a little slow.

reviews.title: We stayed here for conference
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Westin. We got a great deal on the room since there were no conventions in town. The location is great and the views from the hotel are amazing. The water taxi to River Street is a great feature. The hotel was nice and quiet, and we didn't hear other guests the entire time we were there. The hotel is fairly new, and the rooms and bathrooms are nice. The only negative is that the employees don't know when the water taxi comes. We were given several different answers, and finally got a printed schedule from the 3rd employee we talked to. He however did not tell us the correct place to catch the taxi, so we had to wait for the next one. Overall the hotel was an excellent choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a wedding. I did not use the golf course, spa or other amenities. Yet we had to pay a daily resort fee $20.33 per day. Yes, it did give us internet use at no additional charge, but normall that's about $12-13 per day. So the hotel has a nice profit center.
reviews.title: required resort fee not appreciated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful room and lovely lobby. The ferry service to River Street is convenient, but make sure to pay attention the times it runs! We almost missed our ghost tour because we didn't look at the published times! The pool and deck are great and spacious! Overall a great place to stay!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: Very convenient to convention center. Great hotel service and assistance in securing reservations. Free & frequent ferry service to Savannah city center.
reviews.title: Convenient with great view

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in July for a military event with a unit that had just returned from Afghanistan. My room had green stuff on the ceiling in the bathroom and they did not clean it before hand. Hair was on the toilet seat, crumbs under the table, and the coffee maker looked as though it had never been cleaned. I alerted management and he came to my room sprayed the shower and said he cleaned the room himself. He was rude and the overall experience was not that great. Beautiful on the outsie but the people inside just ruin it.
reviews.title: I stayed at this hotel in July for a...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would like to thank Dawn Ryan and the staff at the Westin for a perfect evening. The room was immaculate, the service perfection, and the location was beautiful.
reviews.title: Perfect getaway

reviews.text: The Savannah Westin is truly a treat and the only place to stay if you are attending a conference in the convention center next door. Our room was spacious, clean, quiet, and well appointed. Bathroom was large for hotel standards and the leaf shaped soaps were an interesting touch. The bed was very comfortable but the room temperature was at times a little difficult to regulate. Overall, a very enjoyable stay...with one exception. Where is the Wi-Fi? Even Motel 6 will give you free Wi-Fi for goodness sake!
reviews.title: Where is the Wi-Fi?

reviews.text: I stayed here with my family again (4th stay) and every time the hotel is excellent and the staff go above and beyond.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay
Westin a true resort.
reviews.text: The rooms overlooking the river are great, with views of the ships coming in and out of the port (which my son loves to watch).

reviews.title: Great stay, wish we could stay longer
reviews.text: The hotel is clean, quiet and great value, great location - one of the best.

The Westin is located across the Savannah River from River Road, waterfront of Savannah. There is a free ferry from the Hotel into the town. The Westin has available spa services, sports, and connects by sidewalk to the Convention Center. The meeting rooms were well appointed and nice. The food was excellent. Be aware that the hotel has a resort fee as do most resorts although reasonable. There is a golf course and clubhouse on the grounds. The weekend we were there was an unseasonably cold one, I understand that this was a fluke and the weather is usually nicer.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel but some simple fixes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think I might have enjoyed this hotel more during the warmer months. Husband was there on business and I tagged along. Room was decent size but nothing really stands out for me about this hotel. Dirty glasses were left in room after cleaning along with some trash. Shower head was nice. Food was average although I did enjoy the Sunday jazz brunch there. Fitness center is lacking for my standards.
reviews.title: Average Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights, and got tickets to the semi-formal "Imagine" New Year's Eve Ball. It was held at the Westin, 8-1 am, and the price of tickets included dinner, open bar, dancing (with a band), and toast at midnight. Let me start with the hotel--it's nice, but my husband and I were upset to see the $20.33 "resort fee" and other random "misc fees" we had to pay. They said it was for use of the ferry, spa, parking, whatever, but it should be included in the price of the room.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, terrible New Year's Eve party!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was cleaned every day, very quiet, and we were never bothered by the staff if our "do not disturb" sign was out (this has been a problem in many hotels we've stayed in). The beds were comfortable, and the double shower head was great. The greenway and the view were beautiful, and the lounge was an enjoyable place for drinks.
reviews.title: Another great stay at the Westin

reviews.text: Now, the NYE ball. We dressed up, and got our tickets at Will Call, chose a table, and sat down. The dinner was a buffet, and the food was actually really good. The band was HORRENDOUS. Mike and the Mixers. Terrible covers, terrible singers, and poor choices of "dance music." Around midnight there was an announcement that people could choose to watch fireworks outside over the harbor or stay indoors for the balloon drop; so people poured out of the ballroom down the stairs to watch at midnight. It was foggy, so no one could see anything (no one's fault, but I wish they would have said so), so we went back upstairs to dance. The BAND PACKED UP AT 12:35. No kidding. Everyone came back in, cheering, and excited, and they played the Ren and Stimpy theme song, and DONE. We were horribly disappointed with that.
reviews.title: Gross, dirty, and disgusting with terrible attitude of staff

reviews.text: Savannah is beautiful, and we will definitely go again, but not for New Year's. The Westin would be fine to stay at another time, but the next time we travel there, we probably will stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Loved the orchids throughout the hotel and the setting on the river.

aka: Westin Savannah Harbor Golf Hotel Savannah
description: Southern charm meets modern luxury at the Westin Savannah Harbor Golf Resort & Spa, in the heart of the historic Savannah River District. Savannah's premier resort is the prime location; not far from fantastic shopping and nightlife, but removed just enough for tranquility. Enjoy complimentary water ferry service to River Street, renovated guest rooms, meeting rooms and public spaces. The Resort is adjacent to International Trade and Convention Center, 20 min from the airport, 90-second ferry ride to River Street. Be well. Be Westin.
